metadata.synopsis: To be used as a "meanwhile in the city..." transition from act 2 to Intermezzo.Gortash is preparing for his inaugration when a Flaming Fist brings news of a brainquake in the Lower City. Gortash claims that the situation is under control, at which point the Fist transforms into Orin, who mocks him and threatens to break their alliance.Gortash attempts to make peace, for the sake of controlling the brain, and divert her attention to the players. Orin steps down but maintains her threatening demeanour.

10.text: Sergeant. If you are here, I presume Wyrm's Rock is secure, and preparations for my inauguration are complete?
10.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Gortash stands in his office at Wyrm's Rock, looking out over Wyrm's Crossing. He posing for an artist halfway through his portrait.

Footsteps on marble floor - Gortash turns, slightly so as not to spoil his sillouette, to see a Flaming Fist sergeant at the far end of the room, who bows apologetically.

7.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
7.text: Sergeant. If you are here, I presume Wyrm's Rock is secure, and preparations for my inauguration are complete?
7.context: NodeContext: impatient, annoyed to have been interrupted

4.speaker: Flaming Fist Sergeant
4.text: No, Lord Gortash. We were interrupted... another quake in the Lower City. More severe this time.
4.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Gortash is confused by the change in manner of the sergeant.

The sergeant punctuates their sentence by stabbing the portrait from behind. The dagger popping from "portrait Gortash's" neck.

The artist stumbles back and immediately runs from the room.

The Fist transforms into Orin the Red. Gortash reacts with shock, then corrects his demeanor.NodeContext: This is Orin starting "in character" then slowly slipping into Orin's irreverent characterization

2.speaker: Orin
2.text: Your plan is falling apart, lordling. Give me a reason not to cut you to ribbons.

16.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
16.text: Control yourself, Orin. We need to focus on reuniting the stones, or the brain will break free. These quakes are just the start.

3.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
3.text: Neither of us expected the Prism-bearers to kill Ketheric. They'll be travelling to the city. Let's make sure we give them a Baldurian welcome.

8.speaker: Orin
8.text: My prodigal blood-kin is among them.

6.speaker: Orin
6.text: Barely. I made mince of their ugly mind matter, and if they dare return, I will strip out their offal.
6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin turns and stalks out of the room

12.speaker: Orin
12.text: I itch to peel you, to split your skin, to see your skull shine in the light, little tyrant.
12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin turns and stalks out of the room

13.speaker: Orin
13.text: Lucky for you, I harvested a whole family of living-flesh in Rivington at Highsun. They will sate my blade-thirst tonight.

1.speaker: Orin
1.text: But tomorrow, and tomorrow, and tomorrow, and tomorrow, my blades will thirst again.
